sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Our patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. We prioritize listening to and caring for our patients to build long-term relationships with them and help them reach their dental goals. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
There's plenty going on in Northwest Arkansas, pretty much always. Here's a list of a few things happening this weekend:

  • Up, up and away: The 2nd Annual SOAR NWA is back -- a hot air balloon festival at the Drake Field airport is this Saturday.
  • Bicycle ride: Go support the cyclists in the Joe Martin Stage Race sweeping the streets of Fayetteville.
  • At the drive-In: Free guy and Jungle Cruise are showing this weekend at the 112 drive-in.
  • Music city: Practically anywhere you go, really, music is in the streets with Music Festival Weekend.
  • And a show: American Mariachi, a music-filled comedy, is at Theatre Squared through Sunday.
  • For you country-lovin' folks: It's not too late to see Luke Bryan at the AMP tonight at 7p.
  • Fair fun: The Washington County Fair is ready for you. The last day is tomorrow, so go have some fun!
  • Midnight art: You're invited to Crystal Bridges' Art Night Out for a night of celebration and art-making.

Have fun this weekend, and see you Monday!

posts.title: The Beach at Bentonville
posts.content:
Modern artists and their art exhibits are constantly expanding the definition of what art is and how it can be displayed. The Momentary in Bentonville is in the lineup for the first U.S. showings of a Golden Lion Award winning installation of art. 

  • The space between: Sun & Sea is an indoor beach opera by an all-female creative team who focus on how “theater, music, and the visual arts intertwine.” 
  • Get in on it: The Momentary will be transforming the interior Tower space, importing 25 tons of sand and inviting 13 vocalists to put on the 60 minute show Oct 6-9. Tickets are available to museum members today and nonmembers starting Monday. 

Learn more and get Tickets HERE.

posts.title: Loch Paradise
posts.content:
As the evenings start to tease us with some cool air, the lake is a perfect spot for a nice dinner with some nice company. 

  • Good wine and a view: Fine dine at Lakepoint on the edge of Loch Lomond in Bella Vista Wed - Sun, and discover your new favorite wines and spirits in the Tasting Room Thurs - Sat. 
  • Take a tour: See the indoor and outdoor atmosphere before you go with Lakepoint’s virtual tours. It might just be the perfect event venue you’ve been looking for. 

Go to the Lakepoint website for more details.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a change in your career? Check out these new jobs posted to our community board this week:

  • TheatreSquared is seeking a Marketing Associate to join their team.*
  • KUAF is looking to fill a Community Engagement Manager role.
  • Arvest Bank is hiring a Live ATM Customer Experience Specialist for their bank operations team.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here for FREE, and we might feature it next week!

*content is sponsored

posts.title: Green Cars
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas is getting serious about the goal for 50% of new U.S. vehicles to be electric by 2030. 

  • Environment friends: Rogers-based solar equipment provider Shine Solar made an agreement with Envirotech Vehicles Inc. allowing Shine Solar to start promoting and selling Envirotech’s zero emission electric vehicles.
  • To infinity and beyond: With Shine Solar already providing financially and environmentally sustainable alternatives to power, the agreement with Envirotech Vehicles Inc. will tangibly expand the production of green energy in the U.S.

For more on the Shine Solar, Envirotech partnership, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Woman power: Sign up for the Northwest Arkansas Business Women's conference by Sep 3, and use the code NWADAILY to get 10% off.*
  • Greener pastures: Get your beef straight from a family owned ranch right here in Arkansas with Eat Local Beef.*
  • Fall views:The Ozarks in our state made the list of Top 20 Places to See Fall Foliage in the U.S.
  • A place for two: There are now two private areas to nurse or feed a baby at the Razorback football stadium.
  • Science buddies: A U of A climate science researcher a contributed to a National Geographic sponsored project.
  • Jolly good: We've accepted beautifully strange things happen on Dickson Street.
  • Maybe later: Bikes Blues & BBQ announced last night they will be postponing this years rally.
  • Collab: If you're interested in getting more awareness through our platform, click HERE for our advertising packages.

*content is sponsored

Correction and Update: Yesterday, we sponsored an article for the "Arkansas Local" event hosted by Shared Beginnings. Our title could have implied the event was geared toward children, so we wanted to clarify the event is for expectant and birth mothers. Also, the event that AIM and Arkansas Support Network were hosting at Osage Park has been postponed.
